place.name: LEADEN RODING
place.gazetteerText: ROOTHING-LEADEN, a parish in Dunmow district, Essex; on the river Roding; 7 miles N N E of Ongar r.station. It has a post-office under Chelmsford. Acres, 907. Real property, £1, 330. Pop., 207. Houses, 46. The property is divided among a few. The parish is a meet for the Essex hounds. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Rochester. Value, £230. Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church was restored in 1868. Charities, £5. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
